revised_title: Glutamic Acid Metabolism in Rat Retina
tldr: The authors investigated the metabolism of glutamic acid in rat retina under aerobic conditions. They found that glutamic acid was converted into aspartate, gamma-aminobutyrate, glutamine, and carbon dioxide. The presence of glucose and pyruvate significantly increased the formation of glutamine and gamma-aminobutyrate from glutamate. This study highlights the similarities between brain and retina metabolism.
